lead_paragraph: Representative Keith Ellison of Minnesota has been steadily adding endorsements, but some advisers to President Obama are urging others to enter the race.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin reported from Washington, and Maggie Haberman from New York.
byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and MAGGIE HABERMAN

headline.print_headline: Democrats’ Leadership Fight Pits West Wing vs. Left Wing
headline.main: Democrats’ Leadership Fight Pits West Wing Against Left Wing

snippet: Representative Keith Ellison of Minnesota has been steadily adding endorsements, but some advisers to President Obama are urging others to enter the race....
abstract: Conflict has broken out in Democratic Party over push to make Rep Keith Ellison chairman of Democratic National Committee; prominent Democrats Elizabeth Warren. Bernie Sanders and Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer support move as means of reviving party, while some Pres Obama loyalists are uncomfortable with Ellison's progressive positions.
